page.title: 20CHERRY BURTON-POTTERY 2
page.content: The interaction of the clay,the glaze and the firing temperature had to be understood to be perfected and many months of failure followed,each time for a different reason.Being a purist I also wanted my own glazes rather than buy ready made colours.Test after test had to be made.In 1984 I decided with trepidation to try to sell. Gradually orders came in and I can now happily say that I am in business. When I began I wanted to try everything. I wanted to experience everything that clay would do; throwing,coiling,building from slabs, and because there is so much to find out I still feel the same excitement. It will take me a lifetime - and that is the wonder of it!
